Title: IT Business Analyst
Text:
Position Description

The IG India and Middle East and Global Gases Business Enablement Team (BET) is accountable for the ongoing operations and development of IT applications and infrastructure necessary to support and grow those businesses.

The BET Analyst Position serves as the overall IT relationship manager for select functions within the IG India and Middle East Business (e.g. Logistics, Distribution, Customer Service, Marketing / Sales) and in that role, is responsible for strategic, tactical and short term planning, budgeting, 2 way communication, education, and issue escalation. The analyst will also serve as the point of contact for all ideas and IT initiatives originating in those functions. The analyst will lead the business and IT representatives through opportunity development where the idea is built out enough to outline scope, high level requirements, business drivers and potential solution(s).

As part of the role the analyst will need to develop a strong understanding of both the business they support as well as the IT environment including application solutions, infrastructure and IT processes so they can effectively lead initiative from business inception to IT implementation execution. The role is not intended to lead IT projects but may lead smaller efforts.

PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES

This position is accountable for the following:
Building a strong partnership with business/functional key stakeholders and establish regular 2-way communication to ensure IT is being leveraged effectively to meet business objectives.
Building a strong partnership with IT so that business requests can be effectively explored and so that the impact of any IT changes on the supported business/functional area is understood.
Planning, budgeting and prioritization of IT initiatives for aligned functions
Educating IT stakeholders on business goals, challenges, key initiatives and organizational changes.
Educating business partners on IT including services, costs, SLA’s, governance, key technology projects and industry trends
Developing ideas for leveraging IT into specific projects or work requests.
Development of new IT demand including business requirements and drivers, solution review, initial estimates, funding and resource scheduling.
Providing guidance to business stakeholders on IT processes/requirements, guardrails and where IT can add value.
Ensuring any business led IT use meets our IT security policies.
Helping to escalate service and support issues where necessary.
Acting as a subject matter expert to BET colleagues and business partners.
Working with the other BETs so that any new regional business requirements are reviewed for synergy opportunities.
Promoting business led IT Innovation. Identify and build on opportunities to leverage IT innovation to meet business goals and drive productivity.
Promoting the 4 S’s (Safety, Simplicity, Self Confidence and Speed), in particular, working toward simpler processes and solutions and increasing IT agility.
This position require travel across Middle East and India region to attend business meetings as necessary.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor of Science or Engineering Degree in related field (IT/Comp/Mech/Chem/Civil, etc.)
MBA (Marketing, Finance, etc.) is Plus.
10+ years’ work experience in the IT field leading large/complex IT efforts as an IT business analyst and/or project manager.
Strong analyst skills. Experience working with business organizations and understanding IT’s role in enabling business objectives and driving productivity. Ability to understand business requirements and translate them into IT solutions and designs.
Ability to work effectively across all levels of both the IG and IT organizations.
Good knowledge of the Chemicals or Oil & Gas Process industry, ideally industrial gases.
Experience as a Lead Analyst on IT business facing projects. Ability to lead project teams from option sorting through execution in order to meet business objectives while managing to cost and schedule.
Ability to formulate, communicate and manage to a project plan.
Strong verbal and written communications skills in order to effectively communicate IT to non-technical business users and to interpret business requirements for IT teammates who are not familiar with the IG business processes.
Self-motivated. Ability to work effectively without supervision.
Strong problem solving, influencing and teamwork skills and ability to work with minimal supervision.
Ability to prioritize and manage multiple initiatives.
Ability to educate and also have a deep desire to learn about the IG business.


AIR PRODUCTS COMPETENCIES
All Air Products employees, regardless of their role, share the same nine core competencies. Those who contribute through others, either leading people, projects or organizations, have an additional three leadership competencies. For more information, consult your HR Business Partner.
WORKING CONDITIONS
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Title: Financial Planning and Controls Analyst
Text:
About Wells Fargo

Wells Fargo & Company (NYSE: WFC) is a leading global financial services company headquartered in San Francisco (United States). Wells Fargo has offices in over 30 countries and territories. Our business outside of the U.S. mostly focuses on providing banking services for large corporate, government and financial institution clients. We have worldwide expertise and services to help our customers improve earnings, manage risk, and develop opportunities in the global marketplace. Our global reach offers many opportunities for you to develop a career with Wells Fargo. Join our diverse and inclusive team where you will feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience. We are looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.
Market Job Description

About Wells Fargo India

Wells Fargo Indiaenables global talent capabilities for Wells Fargo Bank NA., by supporting business lines and staff functions across Technology, Operations, Risk, Audit, Process Excellence, Automation and Product, Analytics and Modeling. We are operating in Hyderabad, Bengaluru and Chennai locations.


Department Overview



RMEO is the central point of contact between application business owners and the various risk disciplines that make up the Risk Management Framework within Wells Fargo.

About the role

Internally this designation is known as Financial Planning and Controls Analyst 4. This position will use established procedures and develop new ones to complete standardized Risk Management processes within EFASS (Enterprise Finance Applications Strategy) with a focus on continuous process improvement. The role will interact with leaders across the group and gain an understanding of the various application we manage.


Responsibilities
Work closely with application business owners on quarterly and annual risk attestations and certifications.Provide follow-up and report results to EFASS leaders.
Collaborate with US team members to develop and document new processes supporting EFASS risk deliverables.
Responsible for tasks within assigned risk management discipline(s). Liaise with risk and EFASS team members to effectively and efficiently complete required documentation and exercises by the published due date.
Direct and administer risk activities within the broader team. Assign work, due dates and provide constructive feedback to EFASS partners.
Manage and maintain documentation library. Responsible for version control and access management.
Manage group RMEO calendar, facilitate meetings and keep team abreast of upcoming risk deliverables.
Coordinate meetings and provide thorough minutes to stakeholders.
Partner with risk governance and enterprise finance group on specific risk disciplines including but not limited to; Model Risk, EUCT, BCP, BPM, COSO, Issues and Corrective Actions.
Improve team's performance metrics focusing on continuous process improvement. Present metrics in monthly performance meetings.

Market Skills and Certifications

Essential Qualifications
5-7 years of experience in one or a combination of the following: finance, reporting, accounting or risk management.
CA,ICWA or MBA as preferred qualification.
Advanced Excel skills required include proficiency with nested formulas, data tables and pivot tables
Strong PowerPoint skills, Microsoft word, OneNote skills.
Strong attention to detail but able to understand the big picture.
Excellent organization skills.
Finance acumen with the ability to explain complex financial concepts to team members outside of finance and align business processes to risk management programs.
Preferred Qualification
Ability to work both independently and in a team environment.
Problem solver, inquisitive and resourceful
Strong administrative and time management skills
Familiarity with Relational Database Models and SQL Syntax is helpful
Experience with Documentum, SharePoint, IRISWeb or Essbase a plus.
Familiarity with Wells Fargo internal applications and risk platforms is helpful.
Business System Support experience a plus.

We Value Diversity

At Wells Fargo, we believe in diversity and inclusion in the workplace; accordingly, we welcome applications for employment from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, color, gender, national or ethnic origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other status protected by applicable law. We comply with all applicable laws in every jurisdiction in which we operate.

Title: Business Analyst
Text:
Bengaluru, Karnataka, India
Full-time

Company Description
About Eurofins
Eurofins Scientific is an international life sciences company, providing a unique range of analytical testing services to clients across multiple industries, to make life and our environment safer, healthier and more sustainable. From the food you eat, to the water you drink, to the medicines you rely on, Eurofins works with the biggest companies in the world to ensure the products they supply are safe, their ingredients are authentic and labelling is accurate. Eurofins believes it is a global leader in food, environmental, pharmaceutical and cosmetics products testing and in agroscience CRO services. It is also one of the global independent market leaders in certain testing and laboratory services for genomics, discovery pharmacology, forensics, CDMO, advanced material sciences and in the support of clinical studies.
In over just 30 years, Eurofins has grown from one laboratory in Nantes, France to over 47,000 staff across a network of more than 900 independent companies in over 50 countries and operating more than 800 laboratories. Eurofins offers a portfolio of over 200,000 analytical methods to evaluate the safety, identity, composition, authenticity, origin, traceability and purity of biological substances and products, as well as providing innovative clinical diagnostic testing services, as one of the leading global emerging players in specialised clinical diagnostics testing.
In 2019, Eurofins generated total revenues of EUR € 4.56 billion, and has been among the best performing stocks in Europe over the past 20 years.
About Eurofins IT Solutions India Pvt Ltd
Eurofins IT Solutions India Pvt Ltd (A CMMI Level 3 Company) is a 100% full owned subsidiary of Eurofins. This young captive centre located in Bangalore was established in 2012 to be the largest IT Solutions group within Eurofins to cater to all the internal IT business needs. The primary focus of IT Solution group will be to develop the next generation LIMS (Lab Information Management system), Customer portals, Ecommerce solutions, ERP/CRM system & B2B platforms for various Eurofins Laboratories and businesses.
EITS India is a Young, Dynamic and Growing organization with lot of career growth prospects. We strongly believe that ‘Our people are our assets’ and we ensure that all our staff are provided with great work environment, good benefits and challenging Global projects to enable a fulfilling career. We are committed to provide enriching experience to our employees.
Job Description
POSITION TITLE: Business/Functional Analyst
REPORTING TO: Manager
REPORTING LOCATION: Bangalore
WORKING LOCATION: Bangalore
SUMMARY OF POSITION AND OBJECTIVES:
We expect this role to work with business users. Elicits, analyse business needs of stakeholders. Document and work with different teams for solution implementation. Act as key bridge between business users and project development team.
Job description:
Understand high level objective of the business needs and expectations.
Conducts interviews to gather customer requirements via workshops, questionnaires, workflow storyboards, use cases, scenarios etc
Document the requirements in standard format for consumption (including use case, flowcharts etc.,)
Works with stakeholders and project team to prioritize collected requirements in successful completion of the project.
Ensuring good practices and high-quality standards are implemented and followed.
Performing other related duties as assigned.
EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS REQUIRED:
6 to 10 years of experience as Business Analyst / Functional Analyst for software solutions in development project or product.
At least two full years of contribution to a single product / project a must.
Experience with business requirements, creating Epics, Themes and User Stories
Must be able work with influence without authority
Collaborate with Business Process Owners (GSC HR team in Europe) to elicit, review and document requirements.
Experience with business requirements, user requirements, and user stories
Produce Scope and detailed requirements documented and signed-off by process owners
Prepare and perform functional tests and make sure that acceptance criteria are met before releasing to end-user for UAT.
Ensure that User Stories prepared and updated during the development life-cycle in order to have UpToDate specifications.
As required, Review Test Scenarios and Test Cases provided by QA team.
Should be able to make wireframes, mock-ups and facilitate prototypes as necessary for a given situation.
Strong background in Software Development/Engineering
Experience in testing the functionalities delivered by development team
Knowledge of process modelling
Escalate and follow-up on timely manner any and all issues that might be a blocker, issue, deviations for completion of software development.
Contribute to the troubleshooting, tests and documentation of selected applications functions, at a high-quality level.
Work with the development team to resolve issues.
Will be an added advantage if worked on Human Resource related products/project and possess good understanding of Annual Review Process.
Understand overall requirements and prepare automation strategy (framework, priorities, planning which is to be integrated with overall project plan)
Prepare Test schedules in accordance with project scope/delivery dates.
Strong analytical, problem solving and troubleshooting skills.
Collaboration with Software Architect(s) and other technical groups within Eurofins (Includes design, documentation, prototyping and validation)
Usage of Team Foundation Server (TFS)
PERSONAL SKILLS
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent verbal/written Communication, Interpersonal and Presentation skills. And can explain complex functional/technical concepts with ease (via diagrams, flowcharts etc.,).
Should be a self-motivated, independent, detail oriented, responsible team-player and exhibit exceptional relationship skills
Candidate to have do-it-done attitude; the ability to think critically; enjoy working with teams spread globally and across cultures; a desire to learn in new areas; and the discipline to pay attention to deadlines, details and quality.
Experience in Agile (Scrum) methodologies needed.
Ability to adapt quickly to an existing, complex environment.
Ability to quickly learn new concepts and software is necessary
Methodology skills
AGILE Development (Scrum)
PREFERED CANDIDATES:
The successful candidate will have a self-motivated, get-it-done attitude; the ability to think critically; enjoy working with teams spread globally and across cultures; a desire to learn in new areas; and the discipline to pay attention to deadlines, details and quality.

Qualifications
Engineering Degree in Computer Science/MCA or any other Bachelor’s degree with the relevant experience.

Title: Advanced Business Analyst - Degreed
Text:
Category: Information Technology & Telecom
Location: Bangalore, Karnataka, IN
Does your motivation come from challenges and working in a dynamic environment? Is your ambition to create visible results? Are you enthusiastic about understanding the business and bringing attention to key business challenges? Then we might have the right position for you.
About the department
Global IT GBS is the unit responsible for global IT systems at Novo Nordisk including the operation, maintenance, support and development of these systems. The systems are used on a global scale by all areas of the business from R&D to Sales and are critical to the execution of key business processes such as development, manufacturing, sales, finance, etc.
Degreed is a Learning Experience Platform that can connect to all the resources for learning – training courses, videos, articles, books, podcasts and experts from thousands of sources, including SF SuccessFactors LMS, and has the possibility to curate and push relevant contents.

The position
The position holder is responsible for the operation and maintenance, Incident, problem, Change and release support, governance and compliance, user trainings of Degreed platform. You will be responsible for daily support, system releases, major upgrades, driving and participating in projects, co-ordination and collaboration with stakeholders, be the link between NN LoB and vendors. You are expected to apply knowledge and skills to complete a wide range of administrative/technical tasks, demonstrates subject matter knowledge, achieve day-to-day operations with strong impact on others within or outside the unit, possess good analytical approach and strong documentation knowledge.
Qualifications
We Expect you to hold the below skills and knowledge.
MSC, MBA, BA or similar graduate degree in relevant field (Software Engineering, Economics, Computer Science, Business Administration)
8 years of experience with IT
5+ years of experience in Learning management solutions(preferably SuccessFactors)
Minimum 1 year of experience in the Learning Experience platforms (Degreed, EdCast etc)
Should have experience covering specification, design, development, implementation and operations of IT solutions, process & documentation knowledge covering the entire phase of system operations/ SDLC
Knowledge on Agile, Scrum, SAFe would be an add-on

At Novo Nordisk, decisions and actions are based on their positive impact on society, the environment and on their potential to generate a profit. That makes for a responsible culture with a healthy and engaging working environment.

Title: Business Analyst Tax Software
Text:
Company Description
Masters India is a GST Suvidha Provider (GSP) appointed by Goods and Services Tax Network (GSTN), a Government of India enterprise. Our mission is to build intuitive software solutions for complex problems faced by businesses across the globe. We are fulfilling our mission by offering tax and financial automation products to enterprises.
We offer advance compliance automation solutions to enterprises that reduce their compliance work, increase work accuracy and improve ease of doing. We help some of the largest companies in the world file billions in taxes.

Job Description
We are hiring a Business Analyst to join our project team. You will work alongside other business analysts and report directly to the project manager. Your main tasks will include performing detailed requirements analysis, documenting processes, and performing some user acceptance testing. To succeed in this role you should have a natural analytical way of thinking and be able to explain difficult concepts to non-technical users.
Business Analyst Responsibilities:
Evaluating business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions.
Leading ongoing reviews of business processes and developing optimization strategies.
Staying up-to-date on the latest process and IT advancements to automate and modernize systems.
Conducting meetings and presentations to share ideas and findings.
Performing requirements analysis.
Documenting and communicating the results of your efforts.
Effectively communicating your insights and plans to cross-functional team members and management.
Gathering critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and producing useful reports.
Working closely with clients, technicians, and managerial staff.
Providing leadership, training, coaching, and guidance to junior staff.
Allocating resources and maintaining cost efficiency.
Ensuring solutions meet business needs and requirements.
Performing user acceptance testing.
Managing projects, developing project plans, and monitoring performance.
Updating, implementing and maintaining procedures.
Prioritizing initiatives based on business needs and requirements.
Serving as a liaison between stakeholders and users.
Managing competing resources and priorities.
Monitoring deliverables and ensuring timely completion of projects.

Qualifications
Business Analyst Requirements:
A minimum of 4 years experience in business analysis or a related field.
Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills.
The ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions.
Fundamental analytical and conceptual thinking skills.
Experience creating detailed reports and giving presentations.
A track record of following through on commitments.
Experience leading and developing top performing teams.
A history of leading and supporting successful projects.

Additional Information
Why Us?
A nurturing environment
A promising role with a good amount of responsibility
A platform to perform
A chance to hone your communication skills while you work and interact with people all over India
Experience: 4 + Years
Location: Noida, Sector 63
Employment Type: Permanent
Functional Area: Development
Industry: IT

Title: Analyst, Business
Text:
Job Description
JOB SUMMARY:
The IT Business Analyst SAP will provide process and system support to our internal Behr customers in various countries. This individual will work closely with Business Analysts in the US and India across functional areas and partner with the business to provide assistance to functional users and act as liaison between the business and technical teams. This includes gathering business requirements, translating them into functional requirements, recommending and implementing solutions by configuring SAP and working with ABAP developers and other technical teams to meet ongoing business needs.
Must be ready and able to work flexible hours as needed
PRINCIPAL FUNCTIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES:
Troubleshooting SAP system issues reported by the business users via Service Now Incidents and providing resolutions
Work closely and effectively with other ITBAs (US and India) and the business units among all functional areas and levels of management
Day to day support of departmental functions for the FICO modules ( FI-GL, FI-AP, FI-AR, FI-AA CO-CCA & CO-PCA); evaluate system requirements and implement solutions; configure, modify and coordinate testing.
Support different Finance domains i.e. Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Fixed Asset, Product Costing
Resolve issues related to business use of implemented SAP modules and/or processes by working with ITBAs, systems or process owners and project teams to find acceptable solutions.
Create and provide quality training material and deliver training for user assistance and system usage.
Work closely with the SAP ABAP team to build technical solutions as per the business requirement
Researching and monitoring FI related issues for Sales & Purchasing integrated processes
Work in collaboration with business and other IT staff to translate business requirements into functional specifications. Produce appropriate documentation and actively participate in development of technical and workflow solutions.
SAP FSCM (Financial Supply Chain Management) Support experience would be a plus.
ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS: (Overall experience and years of experience in particular skill)
Bachelor’s degree required in Commerce (followed up with either CA/ICWA/MBA)
5-7 years functional SAP experience in SAP FICO modules with knowledge of OTC & MM integration processes
Experience in building & supporting financial interfaces like banks, EDI, third party etc.
Experience with electronic invoicing for Latin American countries, specifically, Mexico and Chile
Proven understanding of the software development lifecycle and methodologies, as well as the specific requirements for maintaining systems in a regulated environment
Proven ability to manage small to medium size projects
Audit experience a plus
BI/Analytics experience a plus
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS:
Good written & verbal Communication skills
Knowledge of general business processes and functions preferably in a manufacturing environment.
Ability to plan and manage projects and activities related to ERP systems
Ability to establish effective interpersonal relations
Excellent communication skills with the ability to interact with all levels of the organization
Time management skills & organizational skills including multi-taking and prioritize workload

Behr India
Shift
Full or Part Time
Full time

Title: Marketing Specialist
Text:
Our mission is to break down the barriers of today to release the potential of tomorrow. Join us today and release yours.

About this role
The role helps us discover key insights from our vast data, stored and collected in different sources by applying data mining techniques, conducting statistical analyses and building high quality prediction systems to drive best customer centric and commercial outcomes. The role leads as a CRM Analyst and helps drive effective customer share of wallet analysis and life cycle campaign activity. Also, enhances data collection procedures to identify and action key KPIs as well as processing, cleansing and verifying the integrity of data. The role owner will work with the commercial trading team to manage customer cohort and offer manager and provide the right price/offer to the right customer at the right time.

You'll have the following responsibilities

Applies advanced technical capabilities to lead or support in key accountability areas or major projects in own area, performing short and long-term performance analysis, reporting, planning and budget management to support formulation of business plans.
Supports the development of clear and insightful material and makes presentations in a variety of forums to manage and maintain stakeholder interaction and senior stakeholder engagement.
Conducts accurate, insightful and timely analysis of short and long-term performance, deriving accurate insights and identifying early indicators of issues or risks to strategy and/or objectives delivery.
Delivers specific projects to shape and progress various aspects of the strategic agenda, using highly advanced technical knowledge of analytics and modelling and inputting to the development of the overall strategic plan.
Works with own team to analyse qualitative and quantitative information and identify key findings to inform strategy development.
Connected Leaders Behaviour

Inspiring communicator: Create inspiring messages, considering different perspectives and delivering simple communications.
Solution focussed achiever: Deliver and coordinate activities and respond positively to challenges.
Collaborative partner: Develop great working relationships with stakeholders, sharing knowledge and collaborating.

You'll have the following skills & experience

Commercial thinker
Analytical and data driven
Excellent organisational and planning skills
Ability to provide excellent written material which is clear, concise and compelling
Good creative skills and an innovative thinker, keen to propose and enhance communication practices
The ability to work on multiple projects, under pressure and to deadlines
Good attention to detail and accuracy
Self motivated, articulate and ‘can-do’ attitude
People management and leadership skills


Qualifications:

Understanding of B2B marketing strategy, planning and execution
An MBA or Marketing qualification is desirable but not essential
Typically a degree and post graduate qualification in a related subject, e.g. Business, marketing, economics, statistics, analytics, etc.
Experience:
Experience of hands on marketing analytics / business intelligence environment. Preferrably 8 years or more experience.
Experience in measuring and analysing large quantities of data.
Experience with data visualisation tools, such as Tableau.
High level of experience in data analysis techniques and advanced Excel.
Should have worked with people from other business locations or functions.
IJP Eligibility Critieria


As per IJP Guidelines’
“If you have an active PIP/Disciplinary sanctions then you cannot apply for a role internally for the duration of that sanction. In circumstances when you are in a disciplinary process but the outcome hasn’t been reached or there is an active appeal then you can apply, however, the Offer could be withdrawn if, subsequently, you’re issued with a sanction or your appeal is unsuccessful. It is the responsibility of an applicant to not apply to IJP in case if they are on an active PIP/ Disciplinary case/ Warnings or sanction. If such an applicant is found to have applied for a role, then, strong disciplinary action will be taken against that applicant.

BT has a key role in British society, fostering change and leading technology innovation. From delivering the Olympics, to supporting the emergency services, to investing more into research than any other UK technology company, we take pride in everything we do - and in the people who work here.

Title: Clinical Trials Associate/Manager, Clinical Research Associa...
Text:
Position OverviewRisk division has a fundamental responsibility to protect the Bank. With group-wide responsibility for the management and control of credit, market, operational and reputational risks, we have a unique vantage point which allows us

Position Overview

Risk division has a fundamental responsibility to protect the Bank. With group-wide responsibility for the management and control of credit, market, operational and reputational risks, we have a unique vantage point which allows us a holistic view of our businesses and our clients.
Nearly 4,000 employees work together in our division to achieve our ambition to be an industry-leading risk management organisation.
In an increasingly complex environment, risk management is fast-becoming the most sought after place to build a career within the banking world. Risk at Deutsche Bank is relied upon to help shape the strategy of the organisation and the wider industry agenda. The Global Credit
Rating Team (GCRT) is entrusted with the work of assigning and surveillance of Probability of Default Rating to Corporate and Institutional counterparties of the Bank. As part of Risks transformation journey, GCRT is bringing Credit documentation to its purview and requires strong analysts to handle the same.
What well offer you
As part of our flexible scheme, here are just some of the benefits that youll enjoy
Best in class leave policy
Gender neutral parental leaves
100% reimbursement under child care assistance benefit (gender neutral)
Flexible working arrangements
Sponsorship for Industry relevant certifications and education
Employee Assistance Program for you and your family members
Comprehensive Hospitalization Insurance for you and your dependents
Accident and Term life Insurance
Complementary Health screening for 35 yrs. and above

Position Description:
Undertake accurate and timely credit analysis of counterparties (including Corporates and FIs) by identifying business and financial risk based on understanding of business model, financial statement analysis, preparing cash flow model/ forecast and peer analysis.
Write Rating reports and credit reviews/analysis for recommendation to senior members for approval.
Active participation in Live trades with onshore credit officers (KCP) by understanding the trade dynamics, providing your recommendation and completing the credit write-ups (Addendum) for the same.
On-going monitoring & surveillance of assigned international portfolios, including rating changes, market/industry developments, news events, etc and assessing the impact on credit worthiness of the counterparty, keeping DBs exposure in mind.
Understand the various banking products (including Trade Finance and Derivatives) and credit documentation for the same. Support the KCP with appropriate checks and its inclusion in the credit reviews.
Monitoring of limits/exposure: Updating Limit amendments and credit relevant data updates in the credit system. Exposure monitoring and timely clearance of Excess tickets. Timely monitoring of covenants and regular discussion with KCPs.
Manage own credit portfolio and assist senior decision makers to make informed decisions based on your recommendations
Interface directly across with the Credit officers (KCP) and other stakeholders (business side, Exposure managements, and various ops teams) to ensure complete understanding of DBs exposure and timely completion of the credit reviews.
Participate in ad-hoc projects related to portfolio exercises (industry/regional exercise), regulatory developments, sector notes, audit exercises and support onshore KCPs for various business strategies.
Ensure compliance with relevant and applicable local and global regulatory and policy requirements

Required education, experience & skills:
Relevant professional qualifications are MSc / MA / MBA / CA / CFA, etc.
Relevant work experience (34years) in credit underwriting
Strong analytical skills, knowledge of financial markets and economic/industry trends
Strong accounting background, knowledge of financial ratios, financial statement analysis, cash flow projections or project finance experience

Other skills:
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English
Must be a self-starter and pro-active in bringing new ideas and solutions to the table
Must demonstrate ability to manage own time efficiently and effectively, and be able to multitask, absorb ideas and facts quickly, while maintaining a strict eye for detail
Ability to apply entrepreneurial skills to develop processes and activities
Deutsche Bank is an equal opportunity employer who seeks to recruit and appoint the best available person for a job regardless of marital / civil partnership status, sex (including pregnancy), age, religion, belief, race, nationality and ethnic or national origin, colour, sexual orientation or disability.

How well support you
Training and development to help you excel in your career
Flexible working to assist you balance your personal priorities
Coaching and support from experts in your team
A culture of continuous learning to aid progression
A range of flexible benefits that you can tailor to suit your needs

About us and our teams

Our values define the working environment we strive to create diverse, supportive and welcoming of different views. We embrace a culture reflecting a variety of perspectives, insights and backgrounds to drive innovation. We build talented and diverse teams to drive business results and encourage our people to develop to their full potential. Talk to us about flexible work arrangements and other initiatives we offer.
We promote good working relationships and encourage high standards of conduct and work performance. Title: System Analyst/Tech Architect, Team Leader/Technical Leader
Text:
Job Description :8-11 Years Experience * This position requires a BA/BS in information systems management or related field OR equivalent experience, plus Business Architecture / Consulting experience. * Certified Business Architect (CBA) and/

Job Description :

8-11 Years Experience
This position requires a BA/BS in information systems management or related field OR equivalent experience, plus Business Architecture / Consulting experience.
Certified Business Architect (CBA) and/or The Open Group Architecture Framework (TOGAF) certification preferred.
Experience with business and systems analysis and design methodologies and tools, and experience with large and complex systems.
Excellent analytical, planning, and communication skills.
Experience with multi-system/platform program integration.

Required Skills:
Strong capability/process modelling skills, particularly in BIZBOK or BABOK.
Strong ability to explain and demonstrate the value of business architecture.
Excellent written and spoken language skills.
Strong presentation skills.
Demonstrated awareness of new systems technologies and how they could be leveraged to benefit the company, customers and providers, new business strategies and corporate initiatives.
Must possess the qualities, skills, business acumen, experience, and discipline to ensure business and systems architecture alignment.
Strategic thinking and leadership with strong abilities in relationship management.
The ability to interface across several channels, acting as a visionary, to assist, proactively in developing project direction.

Preferred Education and Experience:
Masters in Computer Science or Business Administration or related field.
Served as business architect in health insurance payer organization.
Active participant in business architecture organizations.

Daily Responsibilities and Desired Skills:
Architecture Development, Assessment, and Utilization
Lead and consult on multiple business architecture engagements.
Develop, refine, manage and review core architecture products, including: Value Streams, Capability Models, Information Concept Models and Ecosystem Models.
Perform assessments of Value Streams and Business Capabilities; document, score and prioritize gaps and opportunities; assess health and maturity of associated enablers.
Support review and quality control of business architecture products across multiple engagements.
Utilize the Architecture Tool & Repository (Orbus iServer) for the development, analysis, publication, and communication of business architecture products.

Communicate issues and opportunities and make recommendations for improving the effectiveness and efficiency of business architecture services.

Architecture Practice Operations

Provide timely and accurate input to the business architecture workplan.
Support administration, logistics, and communication activities for business architecture governance.

Experience with and effective use of knowledge sharing and collaboration tools, including SharePoint, MS Teams, and Skype.

Title: Senior Manager

Title: Financial Reporting / Analysis / Planning, SrAssc
Text:
Basic Purpose of Job:
The Global Reporting Centre of Excellence (COE) engages with State Street stakeholders, providing innovative solutions to reporting requirements. The COE is based out of our India office and operates at a truly global level. Through ground-breaking technology tools, the COE team synthesize data and present results with appropriate business insight/context in writing and orally to senior management and global stakeholders.
The CoE Analyst role works with a number of State Street largest and most complex global clients and senior leadership, and acts as the key link of COE relationships with client leadership and State Street leadership team. It is a role which requires strong inter-personal skills, high levels of exceptional client communication and engagement, and a disruptive entrepreneurial spirit.
The Incumbent would be responsible to maintain and improve existing reporting and analytics infrastructure as part of Reporting CoE using various tools, methodologies and oversee the business performance analysis including seasonality, response patterns, and variances between expected and actual results.
Responsibilities & Tasks Include:
High level of responsibility and ownership from inception through to implementation of reporting environment.
High level of personal commitment to each task, a can do attitude and a drive to deliver.
Proven history of delivering timely, high quality, senior manager-level reporting and analysis from diverse, complex data sources.
Understand client operations and organization to ensure that the COE service delivery model is aligned.
Conduct Joint working sessions and review meetings engaging multiple business units to ensure prompt and accurate resolution to challenges noted.
Conduct multiple stake holder meetings and Manage Queues to ensure Service excellence.
Strong communication skills to be able to communicate at all levels.
Should have a proactive approach to problem solving.
Good testing principles as well as good defect management skills.
Able to contribute as a team and deliver individually as and when needed.
Provide UI prototypes, develop technical specifications and build interactive dashboard solutions to the agreed upon specifications.
Conduct product evaluations (POCs).
Participate in standards definition meetings and quality assurance peer reviews of their code base.
Develop automation of processes to improve quality and reduce cycle time.
Job Requirements:
Education and Experience:
Bachelor’s Degree (Post Graduate Preferred)
7+ years of experience in Business Intelligence and Analytics
3+ years of experience Tableau Development experience in an enterprise level environment.
Skills/ Knowledge:
Strong verbal communication skills.
Ability to build strong visualization dashboards in Tableau, Webfocus
Strong in Tableau administration.
Tableau development skill set should include visualization development, use of parameters, and report optimization.
Experience with designing complex dashboards taking advantage of all tableau functions including data blending, actions , parameters , etc
Strong analytical skills.
Manipulate and analyze complex, high volume data from various sources using tools like Oracle, SQL, MS Excel etc
Should have strong data analysis and data interpretation skills.
Strong working knowledge of ETL processing and data transformation techniques.
Strong SQL development skills.
Having good data modeling skills.
Ability to understand and collect requirements from client.
Experience in analyzing and interpreting business requirements to identify technical solutions.
Experience in utilizing Source code control software (e.g. GIT, Subversion)
Continuous Integration/Development.
Working knowledge of Essbase, Teradata and SAS is a plus.
Programing knowledge in Java or C# is a plus.
Visual Basic knowledge a plus.
Ability to create MS Access Applications a plus.

Title: 2317 - Systems Analyst II - Statistician
Text:
Cytel provides unrivaled biostatistics and operations research knowledge to our customers in the life sciences industries in the form of both software and services. At Cytel, we work hard to create successful careers with significant professional growth for our employees, as a result of which they work hard to make Cytel successful. Cytel is a place where talent, experience, and integrity come together to advance the state of clinical development.

As a driven and expert Statistician Subject Matter Expert (SME), you will contribute to the development of our innovative and market-leading clinical development product suite that helps our customers to design, model, and simulate complex innovative clinical trials with the potential to create significant value for sponsors and patients by increasing their probability of success and accelerating time to market.

A key feature of such software products is our proprietary engines – software components that implement sophisticated and advanced statistical/mathematical algorithms (e.g. simulations of complex adaptive trials) for our cloud-hosted and on-premise software products. You will be responsible for studying cutting edge statistical methods in leading statistical research publications, designing algorithm specifications for implementing such methods in our engines, guiding developers and testers on implementation and testing of the engines, and performing hands-on testing of such engines yourself.
Summary of Job Responsibilities:
Discuss and analyze software requirements with Product Managers, other SMEs, and Software Engineers.
Acquire necessary cross-functional knowledge of Software Engineering concepts and processes in order to provide required statistical support in the software requirements analysis process.
Study statistical research papers and other publications.
Design and document sufficiently detailed algorithm specifications for complex statistical/mathematical methods that Software Engineers can implement and test.
Help developers and testers understand these algorithms well and guide the development of the engines.
Guide the testers on developing test strategies and test cases for the engines.
Study R packages, Python libraries, and other third-party statistical software that could be used to perform comparative testing of Cytel’s engines.
Write code in R/Python to explore computational properties of algorithms (like statistical and numerical accuracy) and test these algorithms. Guide statistician testers in the team to do the same.
Perform hands-on testing of the software, especially its statistical features.
Attend relevant webinars, conferences, and other industry events to keep your knowledge up to date. Collaborate with other experts at Cytel in their research.
Follow the standard processes applicable to your work.
Qualifications, Skills, and Experience:
Master’s in Statistics required. Ph.D. candidates do not require any industry experience, but candidates with a Ph.D. in Biostatistics and knowledge of clinical trials preferred
Master’s candidates require at least 4 years of experience working as a Biostatistician/Analyst/Data Scientist in the Life Sciences industry and demonstrated expertise in areas like clinical trial designing or complex data analysis
Strong mathematical and logical aptitude, analytical mindset
Strong knowledge of probability theory, statistical distributions, hypothesis testing and inference, sample size calculation, design of experiments, large/small sample methods, frequentist, and Bayesian analysis
Strong knowledge of Applied Mathematics, including numerical methods, calculus, linear algebra, mathematical modeling, and optimization
Experience with large scale data experiments and statistical methods is desired
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Good knowledge of R or Python
Optional Skills and Experience (preferred but not mandatory):
Knowledge of adaptive clinical trials, Bayesian methods applied to clinical trials, and methods of multiplicity adjustment is highly preferred
Experience of testing statistical/mathematical algorithms
Strong programming skills
What’s in it for you:
Working for a company has created pioneering, path-breaking, and industry-leading statistical software like East®, StatXact®, and LogXact®
Working on cutting edge statistical methods used in clinical trials
Contributing to intellectual property (IP) creation
Working with internationally renowned Biostatisticians
Attending and presenting at national and international conferences
Opportunity to play an integral role in helping our clients and the industry shape the future of drug development
Being a part of an exciting new chapter in Cytel’s history with high growth and opportunities
Working in an environment designed for an entrepreneurially-minded person with a lot of energy, ideas, and the courage to implement
Working with and leveraging the best and brightest minds in the industry

Why Cytel?
Our collaborative working environment encourages innovation and rewards results, and we are proud to have one of the lowest turnover rates in the industry.
In addition to competitive compensation, we offer an excellent benefit’s package, annual bonus incentive, promote work-life balance, and the opportunity to grow with us!
Work with respected experts and thought leaders
Cytel Inc. is an Equal Employment / Affirmative Action Employer. Applicants are considered for all positions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristics protected by law.

Cytel does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact Cytel’s human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to Cytel. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and Cytel. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of Cytel. Cytel shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies.

Title: Senior Geospatial Technology Analyst
Text:
Grow with the best. Join a smart, creative, and inspired team that works behind the scenes to support operational excellence. Our functional services teams (FSTs) provide services to 22,000 employees in over 400 locations worldwide. Bringing together individuals with diverse backgrounds, talents, and expertise, our FSTs are vital to making our Company stronger.
Your Opportunity
The Geospatial Technology Program Group within the Innovation Office's Digital Technology and Innovation team has a career opening for an individual to perform various duties related to research & development, new product research & testing and incubation of geospatial ideas. The successful candidate will become a member of the Innovation Office and will be accessible to project teams to support project work as needed. Our digital experts conduct research and development to keep our teams—and your projects—ahead of the technological curve. They implement established technologies and find emerging solutions for all business lines, bridging existing knowledge domains and facilitating the integration of powerful tools and methods. Our goal is to make projects more efficient and help provide higher-quality results to your clients.
Your Key Responsibilities
Esri Related
Perform new product research and application to business line use
Implement and manage ArcGIS Enterprise
Develop storymaps for projects, marketing & business development
Research and deploy ArcGIS Integration with O365
Provide Esri and AutoDesk integration support
Integration with Stantec applications (ORACLE, Pipeline, Marketing maps)
Development
Collaborate with the Digital Solutions team within the Innovation office
Integration with Geospatial solutions within the Azure Dev ops environment
API integration
Simple geospatial app development
Reality Capture
Assist staff with data management, trouble shooting, point cloud data storage and processing
Provide assistance in the management of Stantec's drone program
Provide documentation and guidance on GNSS Correction services
Miscellaneous
Assist in the development of documentation of Geospatial standards, best practices and hardware/software standards in use across the organization
Assist with initiatives identified by the GIS Community of Practice or other CoP's as necessary
Provide oversight and guidance on centralized data management, governance, support
Incubate geospatial ideas
Consult on geospatial digital solutions
POSITION CAN BE LOCATED ANYWHERE IN CANADA, USA OR OTHER PARTS OF THE WORLD.
Your Capabilities and Credentials
The ideal candidate will be a self-starter, highly interested in the application of new geospatial technologies and a critical thinker.
In addition, the successful candidate will have extensive experience with:
Esri’s suite of GIS software
GIS data sources, cartography, and geographic concepts
Data management, governance
GPS equipment
Python scripting and automated techniques for processing data
Online cloud-based GIS (e.g. ArcGIS Online) for data collection, manipulation, sharing, and presentation
Defining workflow processes and leading implementation teams
Additional capabilities include :
Applying critical thinking skills to develop innovative solutions
Ability to direct and execute highly complex or specialized projects
Attention to detail
Communication, interpersonal skills as applied to interaction with coworkers, supervisor, and clients, etc. sufficient to exchange or convey information and to receive work direction
Ability to anticipate and identify client needs and synthesize them into concepts and solutions
Presenting to external audiences
Knowledge of Project Management principles
Ability to effectively organize, plan, prioritize, and manage time and competing priorities
Education and Experience
A Bachelor’s Degree in GIS, Geology, Geography, Geomatics, Engineering, or a related field and 5-10 years of GIS experience; or, an equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to successfully perform the essential duties of the job. Master’s degree and GISP preferred.
Typical office environment working with computers and remaining sedentary for long periods of time. Field work may include exposure to the elements including inclement weather.
This description is not a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that may be required of the employee and other duties, responsibilities and activities may be assigned or may be changed at any time with or without notice.
Stantec is a place where the best and brightest come to build on each other’s talents, do exciting work, and make an impact on the world around us. Join us and redefine your personal best.

Schedule: Full-time

Title: Manager, Analytics & Metrics
Text:
GBSC is seeking a dynamic, high-performing and self-driven individual to assist in the development and execution of its Internal Audit data analytics, automation and visualization management program. The data analytics/automation/visualization management program will enable Mastercard to achieve its business goals of efficiency and effectiveness in managing Internal Audit. As a Manager of Data Analytics, you will:

Role

Assist the Data Analytics Director in assessing, developing and executing on the Internal Audit data analytics/automation/visualization management framework and develop and execute a strategy for continuous enhancement of the framework
Help drive performance of analytics solutions to impact overall business results
Lead multiple analytics projects and initiatives supporting Internal Audit
Assist in short-term and long-term prioritization of Internal Audit's overall analytical needs and opportunities
Coordinate with Internal Audit and other teams to identify new data-driven approaches for the purpose of generating business insights through data analytics, automation, data visualization, and addressing audit issues in a proactive manner
Create, validate and interpret reports and presentations for senior management, departmental leads, and relevant stakeholders
Facilitate joint brainstorming and team collaboration with broader Internal Audit group

All About You:

A minimum of a Bachelors degree (Masters a plus) in Data Science, Computer Science, Information Technology, Economics, Information Systems, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Business Administration, or any other related field. An equivalent of this requirement in working experience is also acceptable for the position
A candidate for this position must have had at least 5 years of working experience in a data analyst or data warehousing position, preferably working as a Senior Data Analyst or equivalent in a fast-paced financial services environment. The candidate will also have had a proven and successful experience in the managing data analytics/automation/visualization initiatives, leading to the development of useful insights
The candidate will also demonstrate success leading a team as well as experience working with a wide range of data
Demonstrate skills in Oracle Financial, SQL server reporting services, Python, Tableau, Alteryx, analysis services, or any other data visualization tools. Working knowledge of ACL a plus
Familiarity with relevant Payment Card Industry and related regulations is a plus
Prior role within Big-4 Consulting or Internal Audit function covering data analytics / automation / visualization is desirable
Ability to multitask and manage team members on projects within a small-group environment
Excellent analytical, verbal and written communication skills
CISA, CISSP, CISM, or CPA license/certification preferred
Due to COVID-19, most of our employees are working from home. We’ve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by phone or video and are onboarding new hires remotely. We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we’re all in this together.
Mastercard is an inclusive Equal Employment Opportunity employer that considers applicants without regard to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
If you require accommodations or assistance to complete the online application process, please contact reasonable.accommodation@mastercard.com and identify the type of accommodation or assistance you are requesting. Do not include any medical or health information in this email. The Reasonable Accommodations team will respond to your email promptly.

Title: Business Development Operations Lead Analyst
Text:
For over 10 years, Zscaler has been disrupting and transforming the security industry. Our 100% purpose-built cloud platform delivers the entire gateway security stack as a service through 150 global data centers to securely connect users to their applications, regardless of device, location, or network in over 185 countries protecting over 3,500 companies and 100 Million threats detected a day.
We work in a fast-paced, dynamic, and make it happen culture. Our people are some of the brightest and passionate in the industry that thrives on being the first to solve problems. We are always looking to hire highly passionate, collaborative, and humble people that want to make a difference.
Position: Business Development Operations Lead Analyst

Location: Bengaluru, India
The Business Development Operations Lead Analyst will report to the VP Business Development. The role is part of our corporate Business Development (BD) team that is responsible for the strategic direction and execution of global BD initiatives, including strategic technology alliances and partner ecosystem. This position will be responsible for Business Insights & Reporting and help support technology partner GTM operations with tools such as Salesforce.com, Marketo, and Google Suite. In addition to these tools, the candidate would be required to use Excel, PowerPoint, and Tableau to present insights and outcomes of Technology Partner activity as needed to review GTM initiatives with Technology Alliances and strategize better leverage of Technology Partner Ecosystem for fuelling sales growth.
The ideal candidate has a passion for data analytics, attention to details, and strategic business acumen of an MBA graduate. The individual should be an execution-focused, self-driven, team player that displays maturity and inspires confidence; with excellent people skills and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment where multi-tasking is the norm.


Responsibilities/What You’ll Do
BD weekly, monthly and quarterly analytics
SFDC clean-up and maintenance relevant for Technology Partners
Support the BD team with reports and dashboards
Own ad-hoc analytics and account mapping requests from BD team leadership
Support operational programs and initiatives to improve engagement and impact with Technology Partners.
Support US-based BD team, while collaborating closely with India based Sales Operations and Marketing Operations teams.
Qualifications/Your Background
Engineering or MBA degree, with 4+ years of sales and/or marketing operations experience in the software industry required. Prior experience working with US-based teams highly desirable.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with strategic business acumen and a get-it-done attitude. Detail-oriented, high accuracy in work, strong timeline adherence, consistent cross-reference auditing.
Organized to manage multiple, concurrent projects and self-driven to work independently. Ability to translate requests/needs to the application of appropriate tools, and track/follow up on expected outcomes.
Strong collaboration skills, while thriving in a fast-paced, changing environment.
Excellent communication skills, written, interpersonal, and presentation skills, with the ability to interface with all levels of employees including Senior Executives.
Proficiency in data management tools including experience with:
SalesForce.com
Tableau
Marketo
MS Office Suite (PowerPoint, Excel)
Google Suite

Why Zscaler?
Zscaler is the world’s leading software-as-a-service security platform
We deliver best of breed security services with unprecedented scale
100 Million threats detected a day across 185+ countries
Glassdoor rating of 4.7/5.0 + 98% CEO Approval = Exceptional place to work!
People who excel at Zscaler are smart, motivated and share our values. Ask yourself: Do you want to team with the best talent in the industry? Do you want to work on disruptive technology? Do you thrive in a fluid work environment? Do you appreciate a company culture that enables individual and group success and celebrates achievement? If you said yes, we’d love to talk to you about joining our award-winning team.
Learn more at zscaler.com or follow us on Twitter @zscaler. Additional information about Zscaler (NASDAQ: ZS ) is available at http://www.zscaler.com. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.

Title: Regulatory Risk Analyst
Text:
Regulatory Risk Analyst-20000OB4

Applicants are required to read, write, and speak the following languages: English
Preferred Qualifications
Group Details
The role is part of the Product Development and Engineering Group for Financial Analytics Application (OFSAA) within Financial Services Global business unit of Oracle. The group focuses on managing the regulatory compliance with respect to various risk applications, right from data expectations till the reporting requirements.

Project / Role Details
The role exists in the Capital Adequacy Product Management team, which works on all the Capital Adequacy requirements (Basel requirements). The role is that of a Senior Regulatory Analyst and is an Individual Contributor role. The person is expected to be the subject matter expert in Capital Adequacy Risk Regulation and related matters, and can be across various guidelines like . The primary purpose of the role is to guide the technical product development team on the product requirement from a functional/business perspective.

Responsibilities:
Gather and document business requirement
Interpreting risk regulation and preparation of Functional Design Document in order to build regulatory compliance within the product
Coordinating with the product development team on functional requirements of the product
Preparation and validation of functional test data and expected results for carrying on quality checks on the end product
Participating in the functional quality assurance of the product prior to release
Investigating and resolving data & underlying functionality issues in the product
Required Skills:
Qualification at Master level in Finance (E.g. MBA, PG Diploma etc)
Strong understanding of financial risk management in banks
Around 7 years of relevant experience in functional role in banks or techno-functional role in software companies
If experience is in a bank, it should be within the Risk Management function in areas like capital management, risk reporting, risk data management etc
If the experience is in a software company, it should be within the Risk & Compliance function with focus on banking clients
Understanding of current and upcoming risk regulation around Credit, Counterparty Credit, Market & Operational Risk, Net Capital Calculations, Capital Ratio Calculations, Large Exposures, and Leverage Ratio.
Detailed understanding of and prior experience in Basel Capital Adequacy Guidelines and different capital calculation methodologies – Standardized Approach, Foundation IRB Approach, Advanced IRB Approach.
Basic SQL and data management skills
Ability to interpret new risk regulations/ guidelines
Strong oral and written communication
Ability to work in Agile methodology to meet the rigorous regulatory timelines.
Desired Skills:
Certifications like FRM, PRM or any other Risk certification will be an advantage
Ability to appreciate difference in risk regulatory requirements in different jurisdictions
Intermediate level of understanding of Statistics is desired though not mandatory
Ability to connect details with the broader objective of the product
Good presentation skills
Understanding of Credit Risk Economic Capital Requirements, Operational Risk Economic Capital Requirements.
Understanding of various Pillar 2 Requirements
Ability to understand the reporting requirements in the form of Pillar 3 Requirements, and Regulatory Reports
Detailed Description and Job Requirements
Work as part of a team that acts as the central resource and driving force for the design, process, manufacturing, test, quality and marketing of product(s) as they move from conception to distribution. Organize interdepartmental activities ensuring completion of the project/product on schedule and within budget.

As a member of the product development division, you will define product specifications and or strategy. Gather and analyze information to define product specifications and review design specifications. Communicate product strategy and functionality. Initiate and foster relationships with other groups. Review product documentation and collateral. Ensure successful product releases based on corporate priorities.

Duties and tasks are varied and complex, needing independent judgment. Fully competent in own area of expertise. May have project lead role and or supervise lower level personnel. BS or MS degree or equivalent experience relevant to functional area. 4 years of software engineering or related experience.

Title: Senior Business Analyst - Strategic Sourcing
Text:
The Company
Freshworks provides innovative customer engagement software for businesses of all sizes, making it easy for teams to acquire, close, and keep their customers for life. Freshworks Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) products provide a 360-degree view of the customer, are ready to go, easy to use, and offer a quick return on investment. Headquartered in San Mateo, USA, Freshworks 2,000+ team members work in offices throughout the world. Freshworks has global offices in India, Singapore, Australia, UK, Netherlands, France and Germany. The company counts over 220,000 businesses in its customer-for-life community around the world including Honda, Bridgestone, Hugo Boss, University of Pennsylvania, Toshiba, Sling TV and Cisco.
Freshworks’ suite of products that transform the way world-class organizations collaborate with customers and co-workers, include Freshdesk (Omni-channel customer support), Freshservice (IT Service Desk), Freshsales (Intuitive fully-integrated CRM), Freshmarketer (Marketing Automation Suite), Freshteam (HR Management System for growing teams), Freshchat (Modern messaging software) and Freshcaller (Cloud PBX system).

Freshworks has received numerous accolades from analysts and media including making it to Forbes’ Cloud 100 list, Economic Times Startup of the Year, 2019 LinkedIn Top 25 Companies to work for in India and a listing on the Magic Quadrant for CRM Customer Engagement & IT Service Management. While Freshworks has had incredible organic growth over the last few years, the company also has made targeted acquisitions that add critical capabilities to the portfolio including Natural Language Processing, Chatbots, Machine Learning, Social and Messaging Transformation. Freshworks has raised over $400 million in capital and is funded by Accel, CapitalG, Sequoia Capital and Tiger Global Management. More information is available at www.Freshworks.com.
Freshworks is seeking an Analyst to join our finance team. This is a challenging role responsible for driving the assessment, preparation and presentation of key strategic financial, forecasting models and driving public cloud governance. The Business Analyst (BA) will report to the Manager of Strategic sourcing.

Responsibilities:
Manage public cloud cost, usage and governance
Drive data analysis and reporting, highlighting key insights and recommended actions (levers for improvement)
Partner across the organization in developing and refining best practices and governance for public cloud adoption, usage and performance
Partner with organizational leaders in understanding use cases, implementing and controlling expenditures
Build and refine a driver based public cloud model for the organization
Build partnerships internally to both support and influence strategic decisions
Build partnerships with public cloud providers
Perform periodic peer and competitive benchmarking analysis
Responsible for public cloud forecasting, annual planning, long range planning and actuals reporting

Qualifications, Professional Skills:
Graduate or post graduate preferably in finance, with 1-5 years of experience in a project management/forecasting/public cloud governance role
Familiarity with spreadsheets and powerpoint required
Experience in public cloud management - AWS/GCP/Azure
Experience in an IT software / product company preferred
Demonstrated ability to derive analytical insights from trended data
Ability to independently drive projects based on analysis, across multiple teams
Strong Team Player, excellent business partnering skills, positive attitude and good work ethic
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Experience with P&L analysis and an understanding of GAAP accounting and finance concepts
Ability to manage competing priorities and work independently while meeting deliverables under tight time constraints

Title: Analyst, Info Sys 4
Text:

Company Overview
Calling the adventurers ready to join a company that's pushing the limits of nanotechnology to keep the digital revolution rolling. At KLA, we're making technology advancements that are bigger—and tinier—than the world has ever seen.

Who are we? We research, develop, and manufacture the world's most advanced inspection and measurement equipment for the semiconductor and nanoelectronics industries. We enable the digital age by pushing the boundaries of technology, creating tools capable of finding defects smaller than a wavelength of visible light. We create smarter processes so that technology leaders can manufacture high-performance chips—the kind in that phone in your pocket, the tablet on your desk and nearly every electronic device you own—faster and better. We're passionate about creating solutions that drive progress and help people do what wouldn't be possible without us. The future is calling. Will you answer?
Group/Division
The Information Technology (IT) group at KLA is involved in every aspect of the global business. IT’s mission is to enable business growth and productivity by connecting people, process, and technology. It focuses not only on enhancing the technology that enables our business to thrive but also on how employees use and are empowered by technology. This integrated approach to customer service, creativity and technological excellence enables employee productivity, business analytics, and process excellence.

Experience in programming and performance tuning of DB objects such as star schemas, tables, views, indexes, stored procs and functions.
Build processes supporting data transformation, metadata and workload management.

Must be self- motivated, track and follow-up with action items.

Excellent oral and written communication skills
Good understanding of business process, must have had client interaction/collaboration experience and independent contributor
Proven background from SAP ECC, SAP CRM, SAP HANA technical and functional areas.

Title: AWM_Asset Management_Client Reporting Analyst
Text:
J.P. Morgan Asset Management is a leading manager of choice for institutions, financial intermediaries and individual investors, worldwide. With a heritage of more than two centuries, a broad range of core and alternative strategies, and investment professionals operating in every major world market, we offer investment experience and insight that few other firms can match.
Clear focus on managing client assets and delivering strong risk-adjusted returns.
Investment professionals providing strategies spanning the full spectrum of asset classes, including equity, fixed income, cash liquidity, currency, real estate, hedge funds and private equity.


Global Reporting & Publishing Team forms part of Global Investment Management Client Service group within JP Morgan Asset Management. The team supports Global Sales and Marketing teams, Client Account Managers and Products teams in delivering first class service to our clients across all product groups and strategies for global institutional investor and funds.

Prepare and deliver all assigned bespoke customized and automated client and fund reports and other assigned tasks with highest accuracy and in a timely manner through the use of reporting tools and procedures

Adhere to company's code of conduct as well as complete all mandatory trainings

Support all aspects improvement of the Reporting processes, including opportunities to build efficiency and enhanced control measures

Ability to communicate in a clear, concise and efficient manner with multiple teams and stakeholders
Assisting the team in maintaining existing reporting procedures, tools and workflows necessary to facilitate the process
Outstanding accuracy and attention to detail

Partner with technology and perform UAT testing for any of the new enhancements and work on the project cycle
Organization, prioritization and multi-tasking skills
Strong work ethic and positive attitude

Graduate with 4-5 years of experience / Post graduate with 2-3 years of experience
CFA pursuant would have a distinct advantage
Investment accounting knowledge and/or regulatory experience would be advantageous
Understanding of the asset management business, various asset classes and investment products is desirable
Ability to quickly gain broad knowledge of the range of assigned JPMAM investment products, in order to succeed in the role
Financial market awareness and understanding of basic financial concepts
Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Adobe Acrobat and Outlook skills (intermediate/advanced)
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written; excellent writing skills in English
Outstanding numeracy/quantitative skills
JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.
